required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nimotuzumab Combined With Radiotherapy in High-risk Patients With HNSCC Not Suitable for Cisplatin After Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Clinical Study of Nimotuzumab Combined With Concurrent Radiotherapy Versus Radiotherapy Alone in High-risk Patients With Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma Not Suitable for Cisplatin After Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Eye & ENT Hospital of Fudan University

clinical_study.source: Eye & ENT Hospital of Fudan University

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a prospective, open label, multicenter, randomized controlled clinical trial. The main purpose of the study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of nimotuzumab combined with concurrent radiotherapy versus radiotherapy alone in high-risk patients with HNSCC not suitable for cisplatin after surgery. The subjects were randomly divided into study group (nimotuzumab combined with concurrent radiotherapy) and control group (radiotherapy alone) by 1∶1 stratified random method.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective, open label, multicenter, randomized controlled clinical trial. The main purpose of the study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of nimotuzumab combined with concurrent radiotherapy versus radiotherapy alone in high-risk patients with HNSCC not suitable for cisplatin after surgery. The subjects were randomly divided into study group and control group by 1∶1 stratified random method. The study group received nimotuzumab (200mg, weekly, for 6 weeks) combined with concurrent radiotherapy, while the control group received radiotherapy alone. The main endpoint is 2 year disease free survival (DFS) rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life assessed by EORTC QLQ-H&N35
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life assessed by EORTC QLQ-H&N35 [EORTC QLQ-H&N35 is a specific quality of life assessment scale based on EORTC QLQ-C 30, with 35 items. All of the scales and single-item measures range from 0 to 100. A high score represents a higher response level.]
Including the incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events[Safety and Tolerability]. Adverse events should be reported and graded according to CTCAE version 5.0.

other_outcome.measure: The change of tumor related markers
other_outcome.description: The correlation of the value of EGFR, SCC-Ag, CEA and therapeutic effect [The changes of serum tumor markers (such as SCC-Ag and CEA were observed before and after treatment. The baseline EGFR levels on the prognosis of patients should also be explored]

clinical_study.condition: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma

arm_group.description: The study group received nimotuzumab (200mg, weekly, for 6 weeks) combined with concurrent radiotherapy.
The control group received radiotherapy alone.

intervention.description: The study group received nimotuzumab (200mg, weekly, for 6 weeks) in combination with radiotherapy.

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University
Huadong Hospital Affiliated to Fudan University
Shanghai General Hospital/First People's Hospital Affiliated with Shanghai Jiao Tong University

condition_browse.mesh_term: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck
